CSSJustify-content.summary: The CSS justify-content property defines how the browser distributes space between and around content items along the Main Axis of a flex container, and the inline axis of a grid container.

remarks.para: The interactive example below demonstrates some of the values using Grid Layout.

The alignment is done after the lengths and auto margins are applied, meaning that, if in a Flexbox layout there is at least one flexible element, with flex-grow different from 0, it will have no effect as there won't be any available space.
